channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SELFormer: Molecular Representation Learning via SELFIES Language Models
item.description: Overall, our research demonstrates the benefit of using the SELFIES notations in the context of chemical language modeling and opens up new possibilities for the design and discovery of novel drug candidates with desired features.

item.title: SOOD: Towards Semi-Supervised Oriented Object Detection
item.description: Semi-Supervised Object Detection (SSOD), aiming to explore unlabeled data for boosting object detectors, has become an active task in recent years.

item.title: Attention at SemEval-2023 Task 10: Explainable Detection of Online Sexism (EDOS)
item.description: In this paper, we have worked on interpretability, trust, and understanding of the decisions made by models in the form of classification tasks.

item.title: Graph-ToolFormer: To Empower LLMs with Graph Reasoning Ability via Prompt Dataset Augmented by ChatGPT
item.description: Inspired by the latest ChatGPT and Toolformer models, we propose the Graph-ToolFormer (Graph Reasoning oriented Toolformer) framework to teach LLMs themselves with prompts augmented by ChatGPT to use external graph reasoning API tools.

item.title: Ambiguous Medical Image Segmentation using Diffusion Models
item.description: Collective insights from a group of experts have always proven to outperform an individual's best diagnostic for clinical tasks.

item.title: Use the Detection Transformer as a Data Augmenter
item.description: In contrast, DeMix elaborately selects a semantically rich patch, located by a pre-trained DETR.

item.title: Exploring Effective Factors for Improving Visual In-Context Learning
item.description: By doing this, the model can leverage the diverse knowledge stored in different parts of the model to improve its performance on new tasks.

item.title: Monte Carlo Linear Clustering with Single-Point Supervision is Enough for Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: The core idea of this work is to recover the per-pixel mask of each target from the given single point label by using clustering approaches, which looks simple but is indeed challenging since targets are always insalient and accompanied with background clutters.

item.title: Deep Image Matting: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: Image matting refers to extracting precise alpha matte from natural images, and it plays a critical role in various downstream applications, such as image editing.

item.title: WebBrain: Learning to Generate Factually Correct Articles for Queries by Grounding on Large Web Corpus
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new NLP task -- generating short factual articles with references for queries by mining supporting evidence from the Web.

item.title: Transfer Learning for Low-Resource Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Sentiment analysis is the process of identifying and extracting subjective information from text.

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Natural Language Inference with Stochastic Weight Averaging
item.description: This paper introduces Bayesian uncertainty modeling using Stochastic Weight Averaging-Gaussian (SWAG) in Natural Language Understanding (NLU) tasks.

item.title: Can SAM Segment Anything? When SAM Meets Camouflaged Object Detection
item.description: In this study, we try to ask if SAM can address the COD task and evaluate the performance of SAM on the COD benchmark by employing maximum segmentation evaluation and camouflage location evaluation.

item.title: Coherent Concept-based Explanations in Medical Image and Its Application to Skin Lesion Diagnosis
item.description: Early detection of melanoma is crucial for preventing severe complications and increasing the chances of successful treatment.

item.title: Localise to segment: crop to improve organ at risk segmentation accuracy
item.description: Some deep learning methods for the segmentation of organs at risk use a two stage process where a localisation network first crops an image to the relevant region and then a locally specialised network segments the cropped organ of interest.

item.title: Detection Transformer with Stable Matching
item.description: We point out that the unstable matching in DETR is caused by a multi-optimization path problem, which is highlighted by the one-to-one matching design in DETR.

item.title: A Cheaper and Better Diffusion Language Model with Soft-Masked Noise
item.description: Diffusion models that are based on iterative denoising have been recently proposed and leveraged in various generation tasks like image generation.

item.title: Prompt Pre-Training with Twenty-Thousand Classes for Open-Vocabulary Visual Recognition
item.description: This work proposes POMP, a prompt pre-training method for vision-language models.

item.title: Faster Lead Optimization Mapper Algorithm for Large-Scale Relative Free Energy Perturbation
item.description: In this study, we aimed to reduce the computational cost of Lomap to enable the construction of FEP graphs for hundreds of compounds.

item.title: RESPECT: Reinforcement Learning based Edge Scheduling on Pipelined Coral Edge TPUs
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have substantial computational and memory requirements, and the compilation of its computational graphs has a great impact on the performance of resource-constrained (e. g., computation, I/O, and memory-bound) edge computing systems.

item.title: Local-Global Temporal Difference Learning for Satellite Video Super-Resolution
item.description: Optical-flow-based and kernel-based approaches have been widely explored for temporal compensation in satellite video super-resolution (VSR).

item.title: Federated Incremental Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Moreover, new clients collecting novel classes may join in the global training of FSS, which further exacerbates catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: Eagle: End-to-end Deep Reinforcement Learning based Autonomous Control of PTZ Cameras
item.description: Existing approaches for autonomous control of pan-tilt-zoom (PTZ) cameras use multiple stages where object detection and localization are performed separately from the control of the PTZ mechanisms.

item.title: ESPnet-ST-v2: Multipurpose Spoken Language Translation Toolkit
item.description: ESPnet-ST-v2 is a revamp of the open-source ESPnet-ST toolkit necessitated by the broadening interests of the spoken language translation community.

item.title: Missing Data Imputation with Graph Laplacian Pyramid Network
item.description: Data imputation is a prevalent and important task due to the ubiquitousness of missing data.

item.title: Evaluate Geometry of Radiance Field with Low-frequency Color Prior
item.description: Our key insight is that the better the geometry is, the lower-frequency the computed color field is.

item.title: Is ChatGPT a Good Sentiment Analyzer? A Preliminary Study
item.description: Recently, ChatGPT has drawn great attention from both the research community and the public.

item.title: Towards Real-time Text-driven Image Manipulation with Unconditional Diffusion Models
item.description: Finally, we show that our approach can adapt the pretrained model to the user-specified image and text description on the fly just for 4 seconds.

item.title: A Novel Point-based Algorithm for Multi-agent Control Using the Common Information Approach
item.description: The Common Information (CI) approach provides a systematic way to transform a multi-agent stochastic control problem to a single-agent partially observed Markov decision problem (POMDP) called the coordinator's POMDP.

item.title: Monocular 3D Human Pose Estimation for Sports Broadcasts using Partial Sports Field Registration
item.description: Recovering the actual 3D movement of the limbs (kinematics) of the athletes requires lifting these 2D pixel locations back into a third dimension, implying a certain scene geometry.

item.title: H2RBox-v2: Boosting HBox-supervised Oriented Object Detection via Symmetric Learning
item.description: With the increasing demand for oriented object detection e. g. in autonomous driving and remote sensing, the oriented annotation has become a labor-intensive work.

item.title: On Evaluation of Bangla Word Analogies
item.description: This paper presents a high-quality dataset for evaluating the quality of Bangla word embeddings, which is a fundamental task in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP).

item.title: Deep Active Alignment of Knowledge Graph Entities and Schemata
item.description: With deep learning, it learns the embeddings of entities, relations and classes, and jointly aligns them in a semi-supervised manner.

item.title: OpenAGI: When LLM Meets Domain Experts
item.description: Thus, the LLM is responsible for synthesizing various external models for solving complex tasks, while RLTF provides feedback to improve its task-solving ability, enabling a feedback loop for self-improving AI.

item.title: FAN: Fatigue-Aware Network for Click-Through Rate Prediction in E-commerce Recommendation
item.description: Then the frequency spectrum is modulated by category information of the target item to model the bias that both the upper bound of fatigue and users' patience is different for different categories.

item.title: Experience-Based Evolutionary Algorithms for Expensive Optimization
item.description: Our experimental results on expensive multi-objective and constrained optimization problems demonstrate that experiences gained from related tasks are beneficial for the saving of evaluation budgets on the target problem.

item.title: Exploring Operational Flexibility of Active Distribution Networks with Low Observability
item.description: Existing approaches estimating the distribution network flexibility require the full observability of the system, meaning topological and state knowledge.

item.title: RoboPianist: A Benchmark for High-Dimensional Robot Control
item.description: We introduce a new benchmarking suite for high-dimensional control, targeted at testing high spatial and temporal precision, coordination, and planning, all with an underactuated system frequently making-and-breaking contacts.

item.title: Video ChatCaptioner: Towards the Enriched Spatiotemporal Descriptions
item.description: Video captioning aims to convey dynamic scenes from videos using natural language, facilitating the understanding of spatiotemporal information within our environment.

item.title: PriorCVAE: scalable MCMC parameter inference with Bayesian deep generative modelling
item.description: In applied fields where the speed of inference and model flexibility are crucial, the use of Bayesian inference for models with a stochastic process as their prior, e. g. Gaussian processes (GPs) is ubiquitous.

item.title: Class-Imbalanced Learning on Graphs: A Survey
item.description: Concerning the latter, we critically analyze recent work in CILG and discuss urgent lines of inquiry within the topic.

item.title: An investigation of speaker independent phrase break models in End-to-End TTS systems
item.description: This paper presents our work on phrase break prediction in the context of end-to-end TTS systems, motivated by the following questions: (i) Is there any utility in incorporating an explicit phrasing model in an end-to-end TTS system?, and (ii) How do you evaluate the effectiveness of a phrasing model in an end-to-end TTS system?

item.title: Slide-Transformer: Hierarchical Vision Transformer with Local Self-Attention
item.description: Self-attention mechanism has been a key factor in the recent progress of Vision Transformer (ViT), which enables adaptive feature extraction from global contexts.

item.title: ARNOLD: A Benchmark for Language-Grounded Task Learning With Continuous States in Realistic 3D Scenes
item.description: To tackle these challenges, we present ARNOLD, a benchmark that evaluates language-grounded task learning with continuous states in realistic 3D scenes.

item.title: RISC: Generating Realistic Synthetic Bilingual Insurance Contract
item.description: RISC generates look-alike automobile insurance contracts based on the Quebec regulatory insurance form in French and English.

item.title: Curricular Object Manipulation in LiDAR-based Object Detection
item.description: For the loss design, we propose the COMLoss to dynamically predict object-level difficulties and emphasize objects of different difficulties based on training stages.

item.title: CrowdCLIP: Unsupervised Crowd Counting via Vision-Language Model
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, CrowdCLIP is the first to investigate the vision language knowledge to solve the counting problem.

item.title: Unsupervised Sampling Promoting for Stochastic Human Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Specifically, we model the trajectory sampling as a Gaussian process and construct an acquisition function to measure the potential sampling value.

item.title: NeRF applied to satellite imagery for surface reconstruction
item.description: S-NeRF improves on the standard Neural Radiance Field (NeRF) method by considering the radiance as a function of the albedo and the irradiance.

item.title: CLVOS23: A Long Video Object Segmentation Dataset for Continual Learning
item.description: Continual learning in real-world scenarios is a major challenge.
